meanings.definition: To admit or accept back into a group or organization after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: After being away for a while, Sarah was reinducted into the book club.
meanings.sent2: The team reinducted the experienced player after their injury healed.
meanings.sent3: The cat, missing for days, was reinducted into the family with a warm welcome.
meanings.sent4: The old clock, once broken, was reinducted into the living room, ticking again.
meanings.sent5: The lost key was reinducted into the keychain, completing the set once more.

meanings.definition: To formally introduce or initiate someone into a new position or role again.
meanings.sent1: The company reinducted the employee into their managerial role after the training.
meanings.sent2: She was reinducted as the team captain for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent3: The clown, having left the circus, was reinducted with a funny hat ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The sun, hidden by clouds, was reinducted into the sky, brightening the day.
meanings.sent5: The lost puppy was reinducted into the loving arms of its owner, wagging its tail happily.
